newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Stockpile cobalt court hearing set for May 5.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Stockpile cobalt court hearing set for May 5.

text.p: The U.S. District Court for the Eastern District of Virginia is set to hear Minor Metals Inc's complaint against U.S. Stockpile cobalt sales on May 5, a Stockpile official said.
Outstanding deliveries and sales of government surplus cobalt have been suspended pending the outcome of two court cases brought by Minor Metals against Stockpile.
The absence of stockpiled metal on the market has helped to firm up prices, traders said.
The complaint in the District Court involves Stockpile's insistence on a second round of best and final offers in the February negotiated sale.
The Court issued a temporary restraining order barring cobalt sales until the issue was resolved.
The Stockpile official said that on May 5 the judge could rule on the merits of the case, ask for more information or request more time.

The official added that there was no date set yet for the next hearing in the U.S. Court of Federal Claims where Minor Metals alleged Stockpile acted unlawfully on three accounts, including the prohibition of all or none of the clauses in bid offerings.
